availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Newton Cardwell (Booneville, Owsley, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Booneville, Owsley, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Married Joanah Cardwell in Owsley County in 1855. Father of Florence Cardwell and Lena Cardwell. Served in the 5th Tennessee Volunteers as a private and sergeant in the Mexican-American War. Attorney in Booneville in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Major from September 22, 1861 to February 15, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Boonville, p. 341.
